intro: Glaucium corniculatum var. flaviflorum, commonly known as the yellowflower velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of the Middle East. It is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes poppies and related genera. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and wastelands. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional medicine.
